newsitem.title: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO: New Congo names Kasa-Vubu as minister in Belgium.
newsitem.headline: New Congo names Kasa-Vubu as minister in Belgium.

text.p: Democratic Congo's President Laurent Kabila has appointed Justine Kasa-Vubu, a former member of his cabinet, as minister based in Belgium, state radio reported on Saturday.
Kabila's aides said this meant Kasa-Vubu, who campaigned in Brussels against the former Zaire's ousted dictator Mobutu Sese Seko, would become ambassador with ministerial rank.
Mobutu's veteran ambassador to Belgium, Kingulu Moyanso, was last year asked to leave by the former colonial ruler in circumstances that are still unclear.
Kasa-Vubu is a daughter of Congo's independence president, the late Joseph Kasa-Vubu, from whom Mobutu took over in 1965.

She was one of two members of radical opposition leader Etienne Tshisekedi's UDPS party appointed as ministers after Kabila toppled Mobutu in May at the climax of a seven-month armed campaign. She was civil service minister until Kabila dropped her in a minor cabinet shuffle earlier this month.
The UDPS denounced her and another member for joining the government after Kabila had snubbed Tshisekedi, who expected to be appointed prime minister.
Tshisekedi led the internal campaign against Mobutu's 32-year dictatorship and his legion of fanatical supporters have staged repeated street protests against his exclusion from Kabila's government.
